    OnePointCrossover<C extends Chromosome<?>>
    In this one-point crossover, a random crossover point is selected and the tails of its two parents are swapped to get new off-springs.

    Order1Crossover<C extends Chromosome<?>>
     
    class 
    TwoPointCrossover<C extends Chromosome<?>>
    Is a generalization of the one-point crossover wherein alternating segments are swapped to get new off-springs.
    class 
    UniformCrossover<C extends Chromosome<?>>
    In a uniform crossover, we don’t divide the chromosome into segments, rather we treat each gene separately.
